item.title: Missing guard rail, 28th July
item.description:
The steel railings have not been put back outside the mitre pub which now allows vehicles to mount pavement or pedestrians to walk in road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 164, Croydon Road, Anerley, London

item.title: 20 cars parked on the pavement, 28th July
item.description:
Over 20 cars parked on pavement, wheelchair users cannot safely move, i cannot move with my children and my stroller! Why are you putting no parking on pavement signs however there’s no enforcement? Where are the cameras? Can we do anything now?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Avenue, Clapham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter left after bin collection, corner of Stean Street and Dunston Road, 28th July
item.description:
This is what the communal bin area looks like after communal bins were collected today. I keep saying that the communal bin area is inadequate. We now have a lovely new pavement area with flower beds but the bin area next to it looks as bad as ever.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Thrasher Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street not cleaned throughly, 28th July
item.description:
Half of Pickford road starting from the side of Broadway seems to have not been swept for months, you can see its littered with loads of cigarette butts accumulated on pavement next to residents fences and on the road between cars kerb and if someone with an actual sweep would come at least on a monthly basis this would have not been the case’ meaning the road has not been swept for months

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickford Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flyposted 2x iMove and 2x Expose estate agent boards on concrete bollards in the visibility splay on the corner of Anerley Rd and William Booth Rd., 28th July
item.description:
Flyposted 2x iMove and 2x Expose estate agent boards on concrete bollards in the visibility splay on the corner of Anerley Rd and William Booth Rd. This area is owned by Optivo Housing Association and is not part of the curtilage of any one property. This is a repeating occurrence of criminal offence flyposting by these companies.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car parked across pavement, 28th July
item.description:
For months, the residents of 65 Slades Hill have used the pavement outside their house as car parking space. Multiple times a week, especially at weekends, they park their cars so they block either the footway, or the cycle lane, or both. This has been reported before but nothing has been done

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Enfield Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
